page.title: 08ARABLE FARMING NEAR SEISDON
page.content: This is an area of mixed farming with a bias towards arable husbandry, including horticulture. Most of the farming is conducted on a family farm basis, the individual holdings usually being quite substantial. The land is fertile and gives good results if well looked after. Crops include cereals, beet, potatoes and other vegetables. Many farms include some intensively managed grass, either for hay or silage. Fields are of moderate size, some obviously enlarged by the removal of hedges, but there are none of the vast tracts of land seen in other parts of the country and in most cases boundary hedges remain, adding to the beauty and interest of the neighbourhood. Different crops are rotated and rarely do two adjacent fields carry the same crop.
